answers.answer: I am going to assume that the herpes igm blood test is what came back as +. Igm herpes testing is very flawed and current cdc recommendations are that herpes igm herpes testing not be done on adults.at this point, your partner should seek out a type specific herpes igg blood test and go from there. if he is negative, no need for any further testing.grace
Thank you Grace. My partner came back positive for HSV 1. My doctor did do the igm testing but I'm just going to assume that what he has I probably have the same.

question: Hello.I was recently at my gynecology office getting my annual exam, and I informed my doctor that I thought I had a pimple in my genital region and when she examined it told me that she didn't think it was a pimple and asked if I would be interested in getting an STD screening. I get tested for this every year, and since she was already sending me for blood work because she thought I presented signs of diabetes, she ordered a herpes screening as well. Two weeks later I was back in the office, and she told me she was confused by the results. HSV-1 and HSV-2 both came back negative, but it came back positive for acute herpes and I believe the number was 1.08. So just a few days ago, I went back to the same lab and had the test redone. I can't say that I've ever been tested before, which probably means I haven't been. I have been with the same partner for four years now, but unfortunately he had an indiscretion two years ago. Neither of us have had symptoms, or that we think are/were symptoms, and I was also tested for STDs as soon as I was made aware of his infidelity. I suppose my former gynecologist only tested for chlamydia and gonorrhea, which came back negative, and still are.I guess my questions are whether or not the test could have been a false positive, what "acute herpes" actually means, and why both HSV-1 and 2 come back negative and acute come back positive.
title: STD Concern. Help please!
